metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10163 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A Vulnerability has been found in PowerDNS Authoritative Server before versions 4.1.9, 4.0.8 allowing a remote, authorized master server to cause a high CPU load or even prevent any further updates to any slave zone by sending a large number of NOTIFY messages. Note that only servers configured as slaves are affected by this issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10163` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-bind - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-geoip - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-lua - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-mydns - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-odbc - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-opendbx - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-server - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-tools - 4.1.6-3build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.6-3build1').
